intro: Cylindrokelupha laoticum, commonly known as the Laotian cylinder-fruit, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Laos. It is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical fruits that mature to a deep purple color. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces small, white flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
